org.apache.juneau.transforms

Class CalendarSwap

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.transform.PojoSwap<T,String>
      • org.apache.juneau.transform.StringSwap<Calendar>
        • org.apache.juneau.transforms.CalendarSwap
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CalendarSwap.DateFull, CalendarSwap.DateLong, CalendarSwap.DateMedium, CalendarSwap.DateShort, CalendarSwap.DateSimple, CalendarSwap.DateTimeFull, CalendarSwap.DateTimeLong, CalendarSwap.DateTimeMedium, CalendarSwap.DateTimeShort, CalendarSwap.DateTimeSimple, CalendarSwap.ISO8601DT, CalendarSwap.ISO8601DTZ, CalendarSwap.RFC2822D, CalendarSwap.RFC2822DT, CalendarSwap.RFC2822DTZ, CalendarSwap.TimeFull, CalendarSwap.TimeLong, CalendarSwap.TimeMedium, CalendarSwap.TimeShort, CalendarSwap.TimeSimple, CalendarSwap.ToString

    public class CalendarSwap
extends StringSwap<Calendar>
    Transforms Calendars to Strings.
    Behavior-specific subclasses

    The following direct subclasses are provided for convenience to the following formats:

    • CalendarSwap.ToString - To Strings using the Date.toString() method.
    • CalendarSwap.ISO8601DT - To ISO8601 date-time strings.
    • CalendarSwap.ISO8601DTZ - Same as CalendarSwap.ISO8601DT, except always serializes in GMT.
    • CalendarSwap.ISO8601DTP - Same as CalendarSwap.ISO8601DT except with millisecond precision.
    • CalendarSwap.ISO8601DTPZ - Same as CalendarSwap.ISO8601DTZ except with millisecond precision.
    • CalendarSwap.RFC2822DT - To RFC2822 date-time strings.
    • CalendarSwap.RFC2822DTZ - Same as CalendarSwap.RFC2822DT, except always serializes in GMT.
    • CalendarSwap.RFC2822D - To RFC2822 date strings.
    • CalendarSwap.DateTimeSimple - To simple "yyyy/MM/dd HH:mm:ss" date-time strings.
    • CalendarSwap.DateSimple - To simple "yyyy/MM/dd" date strings.
    • CalendarSwap.TimeSimple - To simple "HH:mm:ss" time strings.
    • CalendarSwap.DateFull - To DateFormat.FULL date strings.
    • CalendarSwap.DateLong - To DateFormat.LONG date strings.
    • CalendarSwap.DateMedium - To DateFormat.MEDIUM date strings.
    • CalendarSwap.DateShort - To DateFormat.SHORT date strings.
    • CalendarSwap.TimeFull - To DateFormat.FULL time strings.
    • CalendarSwap.TimeLong - To DateFormat.LONG time strings.
    • CalendarSwap.TimeMedium - To DateFormat.MEDIUM time strings.
    • CalendarSwap.TimeShort - To DateFormat.SHORT time strings.
    • CalendarSwap.DateTimeFull - To DateFormat.FULL date-time strings.
    • CalendarSwap.DateTimeLong - To DateFormat.LONG date-time strings.
    • CalendarSwap.DateTimeMedium - To DateFormat.MEDIUM date-time strings.
    • CalendarSwap.DateTimeShort - To DateFormat.SHORT date-time strings.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CalendarSwap

        protected CalendarSwap(String pattern,
                       int dateStyle,
                       int timeStyle,
                       TimeZone timeZone)
        Constructor.

        Only one of the pattern or style parameters should

        Parameters:
        pattern - The SimpleDateFormat pattern. If null, style is used instead.
        dateStyle - The DateFormat date style (e.g. DateFormat.SHORT). Ignored if pattern is not null. Ignored if -1.
        timeStyle - The DateFormat time style (e.g. DateFormat.SHORT). Ignored if pattern is not null. Ignored if -1.
        timeZone - The timeZone to use for dates. If null then either the timezone specified on the Calendar object or the timezone returned by BeanSession.getTimeZone() is used.

    • Method Detail

      • getDateFormat

        protected DateFormat getDateFormat(BeanSession session,
                                   Calendar c)
        Returns the DateFormat object for this session for formatting dates.
        Parameters:
        session - The current bean session.
        c - Optional Calendar object to copy TimeZone from if not specified in session or timeZone setting.
        Returns:
        The DateFormat object. Multiple calls to this method on the same session will return a cached copy of date format object.

      • swap

        public String swap(BeanSession session,
                   Calendar o)
        Converts the specified Calendar to a String.
        Overrides:
        swap in class StringSwap<Calendar>
        Parameters:
        session - The bean session to use to get the class meta. This is always going to be the same bean context that created this swap.
        o - The object to be transformed.
        Returns:
        The transformed object.

      • unswap

        public Calendar unswap(BeanSession session,
                       String o,
                       ClassMeta<?> hint)
                throws ParseException
        Converts the specified String to a Calendar.
        Overrides:
        unswap in class StringSwap<Calendar>
        Parameters:
        session - The bean session to use to get the class meta. This is always going to be the same bean context that created this swap.
        o - The transformed object.
        hint - If possible, the parser will try to tell you the object type being created. For example, on a serialized date, this may tell you that the object being created must be of type GregorianCalendar.
        This may be null if the parser cannot make this determination.
        Returns:
        The narrowed object.
        Throws:
        ParseException - If this method is not implemented.
